name: PROMETHIUM
descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) is an activity group focused on espionage that has been active since at least 2012. The group has conducted operations globally with a heavy emphasis on Turkish targets. [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has demonstrated similarity to another activity group called [NEODYMIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0055) due to overlapping victim and campaign characteristics.(Citation: Microsoft NEODYMIUM Dec 2016)(Citation: Microsoft SIR Vol 21)(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Access Notifications
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect message notifications from 17 applications.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to communicate with the C2 server using HTTPS.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Archive Collected Data
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to exfiltrate encrypted data to the C2 server.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Audio Capture
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to record phone calls.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has used Registry run keys to establish persistence.(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Windows Service
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has created new services and modified existing services for persistence.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing Certificates
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has created self-signed certificates to sign malicious installers.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Digital Certificates
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has created self-signed digital certificates for use in HTTPS C2 traffic.(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has used watering hole attacks to deliver malicious versions of legitimate installers.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-By Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) distributed [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) through the compromised official Syrian E-Gov website.(Citation: trendmicro_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Symmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to encrypt C2 communication using AES.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Broadcast Receivers
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to receive the following broadcast events to establish persistence: `BOOT_COMPLETED`, `BATTERY_LOW`,`USER_PRESENT`, `SCREEN_ON`, `SCREEN_OFF`, or `CONNECTIVITY_CHANGE`.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to exfiltrate to the C2 server using HTTPS.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)(Citation: trendmicro_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect file lists on the victim device.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to modify permissions on a rooted device and tried to disable the SecurityLogAgent application.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to receive files from the C2 and execute them via the parent application.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Location Tracking
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to access the device’s location.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Task or Service
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has named services to appear legitimate.(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has disguised malicious installer files by bundling them with legitimate software installers.(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) on a compromised website to distribute a malicious version of a legitimate application.(Citation: trendmicro_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to obfuscate code and strings to evade detection.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Call Log
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect call logs.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Contact List
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect the device’s contact list.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: SMS Messages
subtechniques.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect SMS messages.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: Software Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to obtain a list of installed applications.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has signed code with self-signed certificates.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect the device’s information, such as SIM serial number, SIM serial number, etc.(Citation: welivesec_strongpity)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Connections Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: During [C0033](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0033), [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) used [StrongPity](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0491) to collect information regarding available Wi-Fi networks.(Citation: trendmicro_strongpity)

subtechniques.name: Port Knocking
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has used a script that configures the knockd service and firewall to only accept C2 connections from systems that use a specified sequence of knock ports.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has attempted to get users to execute compromised installation files for legitimate software including compression applications, security software, browsers, file recovery applications, and other tools and utilities.(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Local Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [PROMETHIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0056) has created admin accounts on a compromised host.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

campaign_data.name: C0033
campaign_data.desc: (Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)

software_data.name: StrongPity
software_data.descr: (Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: Truvasys
software_data.descr: (Citation: Microsoft NEODYMIUM Dec 2016)(Citation: Microsoft SIR Vol 21)

alias_descriptions.name: StrongPity
alias_descriptions.descr: The name StrongPity has also been used to describe the group and the malware used by the group.(Citation: Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020)(Citation: Talos Promethium June 2020)

Microsoft SIR Vol 21.description: Anthe, C. et al. (2016, December 14). Microsoft Security Intelligence Report Volume 21. Retrieved November 27, 2017.

Talos Promethium June 2020.description: Mercer, W. et al. (2020, June 29). PROMETHIUM extends global reach with StrongPity3 APT. Retrieved July 20, 2020.

Microsoft NEODYMIUM Dec 2016.description: Microsoft. (2016, December 14). Twin zero-day attacks: PROMETHIUM and NEODYMIUM target individuals in Europe. Retrieved November 27, 2017.

Bitdefender StrongPity June 2020.description: Tudorica, R. et al. (2020, June 30). StrongPity APT - Revealing Trojanized Tools, Working Hours and Infrastructure. Retrieved July 20, 2020.

trendmicro_strongpity.description: Dong, Z. et al. (2021, July 21). StrongPity APT Group Deploys Android Malware for the First Time. Retrieved March 19, 2023.

welivesec_strongpity.description: Stefanko, L. (2023, January 10). StrongPity espionage campaign targeting Android users. Retrieved January 31, 2023.

securelist_strongpity.description: Baumgartner, K. (2016, October 3). On the StrongPity Waterhole Attacks Targeting Italian and Belgian Encryption Users. Retrieved March 28, 2024.
